data.title: Hide/Collapse arrow for the split window editor
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Feature Request:
 A hide arrow for the split window editor pane to collapse window with out closing tabs. Just like the Activity Bar, the ability to hide and bring back one side of a split editor pane would be useful. I find myself dragging the window sometimes to view longer lines of code, and I don't prefer wordwrap.

2. Paste it into rich text app like Outlook, Teams, Skype for Business whatever.

data.title: Autocompletion API doesn't allow adding words
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Mac OS 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install all-autocomplete extension
1. Edit any code where you would expect either snippets or intellisense to be offered - you can only see the word completions.
1. This has been discussed in #4791 but the reporter closed it

It seems that the current completion API doesn't allow for **adding** entries to the list, which is a problem, since any specialized completion plugins would only focus on their own domain, assuming the "other" completions are preserved. For example, `all-autocomplete` extension provides much missing feature of completing words from other open files (typical in many modern editors).

If there is a way to use the API so that the extension can add its own entries to the list, please let @atishay know so he can update the plugin. Or please treat this as an enhancement request to allow that.

data.title: Allow to contribute actions to other quick open handlers
Feature Request: Allow extensions to extend "Manage Extensions" status bar right-click context menu
data.body:
Now that VS Code provides a "Manage Extension" right-click context menu off of each status bar item provided by an extension, can extension authors get the ability to extend it?  I'd like to be able to add commands, custom text and a tooltip to the menu (much like SCM context menus) to provide additional functionality.  (I get frequent requests for functionality that would be perfect there in lieu of continually adding new status bar items.)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2796865/26404934/9c975186-4061-11e7-8a9c-9b2e0538d2c6.png)

data.title: JSON empty block comment yields wrong highlight style
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.2 (19222cdc84ce72202478ba1cec5cb557b71163de, 2017-05-10T13:20:36.315Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create "JSON" file
2. type `/**/bah`

Expected outcome
`bah` styled as (invalid) content token.

Actual outcome
`bah` styled as comment. Still properly marked as invalid, though.

Remarks
`/* */` is OK. Same steps in JavaScript file is OK.

![vscode-pseudojson-comment-highlight-bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1761395/26402265/d8b51a40-4089-11e7-84ea-e347100ea0ef.gif)

----

Ad "JSON" in quotation marks: #3641.

data.title: Feature Request: Offer opening binary files with default application
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2.
- OS Version: any

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Click on Pdf in Fileexplorer
2. The file will not be displayed in the editor because it is either binary...

It would be nice if we had a button that would make it possible to open these files with their default applications. Right now I have to right click "Reveal in Explorer" and manually open it.

Relevant place in code:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/6f790f7676581a97918f014bec0cff8f0d690e81/src/vs/base/browser/ui/resourceviewer/resourceViewer.ts#L181

data.title: Allow for ctrl+click to create multiple cursors
data.body:
At this time ctrl + click is used for go to definition and opening links and alt + click is used for multicursor.

There should be an option to be able to switch these.

data.title: How to configure a window (also for reload case)?
data.body:
Possible root cause for #26506

* run `scripts\code.bat` and open an editor
* observe the window shows Ln, Col information in the status bar:
  ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/26400869/62c56b9c-4083-11e7-99b4-7d988d48eecc.png)
* start VoiceOver or NVDA and move the cursor in the editor
* observe the window detects a screen reader is attached and no longer shows the Ln, Col information in the status bar:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/26400889/77ad94c6-4083-11e7-9968-6a83b8319702.png)

**Press ctrl+r**: Observe the screen reader is no longer detected

I believe this has to do with how we create the window in the main process and how we pass configuration options to the window.

I have the same code path for `accessibilitySupportEnabled` as for `isISOKeyboard` -- we wrote this together, but it appears this is not functioning correctly for the reload window case. What else is needed to get the reload case working too?

data.title: CompletionItem is still using TextEdit although docs say it's deprecated
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Win 10 Creators

The problem is that if I don't specify the TextEdit I can't overwrite existing source although it says TextEdit on completionItem is deprecated.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22787221/26400532/a5687aea-4081-11e7-9fb0-6038f51d7fb8.png)


@dbaeumer @jrieken I talked to you guys before so maybe you know more.

I have returned a completion item from the extension which the lsp sees as:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22787221/26253055/4bf097cc-3cb2-11e7-9288-8169bcc82611.png)

so I'm trying to overwrite 1 character from the source code (start of the range is at char 23 and end is at 24)

In the picture below you can see the source code where I requested the completion.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22787221/26253120/855019d4-3cb2-11e7-8985-4a2a2e135f0f.png)

After I pick Address as my completion choice I end up with 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22787221/26253161/a532b978-3cb2-11e7-8eb3-4a148f47964b.png)

although I would expect to get rid of the ; at the end. I also tried providing the range values as if the lines and characters were 0 based but I still wasn't replacing the semicolon ;

I tried using the TextEdit object as a part of my completion item and it's working.
Are you sure you have replaced using of TextItem with the Range?

If I get a completion item looking like this:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22787221/26253774/c46fff38-3cb4-11e7-95f7-d58016716201.png)

Then the character is being replaced as expected

data.title: Scroll area jumps around unexpectedly when using mousewheel zoom

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
**Edit:** The behavior appears to be font-related. Using Consolas, zoom appears to be centered on the middle line of the window, which is fine behavior as far as I am concerned. I guess this is a problem with the font I'm using? Notepad++ appears to have no problems with the same font.

Issue: When zooming with Ctrl+mousewheel when "editor.mouseWheelZoom" is enabled, the scroll area jumps around unexpectedly at certain zoom levels, causing users to lose their place in the file.

Expected behavior: The scroll area should remain fixed (as much as possible) around the same lines of text when zooming. For example, in Notepad++ the topmost line in the editor area always remains at the top when zooming. Alternatively, the line of text closest to the mouse cursor could remain at the same position on screen when zooming.

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro Version 1703

I am using a free Japanese monospace font called "GenEi Gothic M" which is downloadable here: [http://okoneya.jp/font/download.html#dl-geg-m](http://okoneya.jp/font/download.html#dl-geg-m)

Relevant user settings:
    "editor.fontFamily": "源暎ゴシックM",
    "editor.fontSize": 24,
    "editor.mouseWheelZoom": true

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Enable editor.mouseWheelZoom in the user settings.
2. Open a text file long enough that it is vertically scrollable.
3. Zoom in or out repeatedly using Ctrl+mousewheel and observe that the scroll position jumps around unexpectedly.

![vscodemousewheelzoomissue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7123060/26396557/8419509e-40ae-11e7-963c-d763caaac427.gif)

data.title: The used $path differs between the Shell task and the terminal.
data.body:
When executing a ShellTask from the API like this:
```typescript
new vscode.ShellTask(`echo path`, `echo $path`)
```
Then you get this output:
```
/usr/local/bin /usr/bin /bin /usr/sbin /sbin /usr/local/share/dotnet /usr/local/go/bin /Users
/egamma/.nvm/versions/node/v5.10.1/bin
```

When running `echo $path` from the terminal then the path differs:
```
echo $path
/Users/egamma/.nvm/versions/node/v5.10.1/bin /usr/local/bin /usr/bin /bin /usr/sbin /sbin /us
r/local/share/dotnet /usr/local/go/bin
```

Notice that the `.nvm` path appears first, which means this node version will be executed. The node version executed by the `ShellTask` is the one in `/usr/local/bin`.

//CC @dbaeumer

data.title: terminalProcess.js should be a AMD module and TypeScript
data.body:
Is there a reason `terminalProcess` cannot be a TypeScript file and use AMD? In other parts we always fork processes via our amd bootstrap helper. We should do it here as well.

For example: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/electron-browser/extensionHost.ts#L134

data.title: Unable to attach to CoreCLR. Unknown Error: 0x8007054f Linux OpenSUSE
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.
- OS Version: OpenSUSE 42.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Updated Visual Studio Code to  1.12 using  OpenSUSE  instructions on https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/setup/linux#_rhel-fedora-and-centos-based-distributions

2. Opened  a folder  created  from  dotnet new mvc

3. selected the Menu Option Start  with Debugging

dotnet --info output
.NET Command Line Tools (1.0.4)

Product Information:
 Version:            1.0.4
 Commit SHA-1 hash:  af1e6684fd

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     opensuse
 OS Version:  42.2
 OS Platform: Linux
 RID:         opensuse.42.1-x64
 Base Path:   /opt/dotnet/sdk/1.0.4


in previous  version and  current  version  using the  menu  option  start without debugging  the  website  does  start  in the  browser. I get the  following  output  

Executing action method webtest.Controllers.HomeController.Index (webtest) with arguments ((null)) - ModelState is Valid
info: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ViewFeatures.Internal.ViewResultExecutor[1]
      Executing ViewResult, running view at path /Views/Home/Index.cshtml.
info: Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.DataProtectionServices[0]
      User profile is available. Using '/home/jesa/.aspnet/DataProtection-Keys' as key repository; keys will not be encrypted at rest.
info: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Internal.ControllerActionInvoker[2]
      Executed action webtest.Controllers.HomeController.Index (webtest) in 2748.0252ms
info: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Internal.WebHost[1]
      Request starting HTTP/1.1 GET http://localhost:5000/js/site.js?v=EWaMeWsJBYWmL2g_KkgXZQ5nPe-a3Ichp0LEgzXczKo  
info: Microsoft.AspNetCore.StaticFiles.StaticFileMiddleware[2]
      Sending file. Request path: '/js/site.js'. Physical path: '/home/jesa/projects/webtest/wwwroot/js/site.js'
info: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Internal.WebHost[2]
      Request finished in 3125.0155ms 200 text/html; charset=utf-8
info: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Internal.WebHost[2]
      Request finished in 112.4478ms 200 application/javascript

You may only use the Microsoft .NET Core Debugger (vsdbg) with
Visual Studio Code, Visual Studio or Visual Studio for Mac software
to help you develop and test your applications.

Unable to attach to CoreCLR. Unknown Error: 0x8007054f

data.title: ₹ symbol not accepted by editor
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.12.2 (1.12.2)
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Copy paste the ₹ symbol into the editor
2. It is not seen in the editor.  And where it used to be, now there is some weird character.  (I'm seeing this: â‚¹ )

Just noticed another thing.  If I put the keyboard cursor over the symbol, I need to press the right arrow key twice to go past that single character.  Mine is in go code and I had originally written it as "₹".  On the first key press it shows the double quote, and then on the second key press it shows the symbol.  So looks like this is something to do with how unicode is being handled.
